response.summary:
I am Mechanical Engineer and MSc Energy Engineering student (Power Generation track), I bring 3 years of diverse experience in the dynamic oil and gas industry. My passion for finding innovative solutions to the energy sector's most pressing challenges drives my interests in the fields turbomachinery, energy efficiency, hydrogen technologies and process decarbonization. Also, along my professional and academic experience I have developed strong skills in data analysis and computational modeling, for instance CFD analysis and Digital Twin models. I am a seasoned team player and believe in the power of interdisciplinary collaboration to achieve success in the complex world of energy generation.

My expertise in project management, exceptional communication skills, and multilingual proficiency (English, Italian, Spanish) have enabled me to excel in both local and international projects. My in-depth understanding of industry standards such as ASME, API, and ASTM, along with my proficiency in piping component standards, sets me apart in a competitive field.

As I near the completion of my Master's degree at Politecnico di Milano, I have honed my skills in the latest advancements in power production systems, hydrogen applications, and renewable energy solutions (specially wind turbines technology). I am eager to bring my technical knowledge and analytical skills to a company that is committed to driving positive change in the energy sector and offers opportunities for growth and development.

profile_positions.description:
As an Interface Management Specialist, I was responsible for managing the interface between the materials database (SPMAT) and 3D model (SmartPlant3D) for high-profile oil and gas projects such as MIDOR and ASSIUT plants. I effectively integrated my previous knowledge about technical aspects of the selection and purchasing of piping components and successfully adapted to a new role and location in Rome, Italy.

Key Responsibilities:

- Responsible for the interface management in fast-paced projects
- Collaborated effectively with different teams to ensure seamless workflow
- Streamlined the process of reconciling information from multiple sources using data analysis and Visual Basic
- Quickly solved discrepancies in the model and project standards settings to minimize impacts on the production chain

Additionally, I was involved in several other critical tasks, including setting and defining piping classes and designing an emergency hot-in repair piece for a refinery plant. This experience showcased my ability to perform under pressure and proficiency in 3D modeling and drawing.

Skills Utilized:

Self-management
Team collaboration
Data analysis
Problem-solving
Adaptability
Technical skills in piping components and 3D modeling and drawing.

This experience has provided me with a wealth of knowledge and hands-on experience in the oil and gas industry, making me a valuable asset to any organization.
profile_positions.title: Piping Materials Specialist I

profile_positions.description:
As a Piping Materials Engineer, I have extensive experience in the technical selection and management of piping components for the oil & gas industry. My expertise includes designing and managing piping classes using the SPMAT software, requiring a deep understanding of piping components, materials, and industry codes such as ASME and API.


Key responsibilities:
- Technical selection and management of piping components for oil & gas industry 
- Design and management of piping classes based on the SPMAT software
- Participate in technical agreements with vendors and clients ensuring the fulfilling of the project requirements


I have a track record of successfully issuing project standards and uploading materials to a database (SmartPlant Materials), which interfaces with the 3D model (SmartPlant). I was also responsible for issuing Material requisitions and ensuring technical agreement with vendors, taking into account any changes in project standards and variations in material quantities.

I have a wealth of experience in both local and international projects, and have had the opportunity to work with a variety of teams, where my responsibilities and contacts with clients and vendors varied greatly. I attribute my success in these roles to my ability to effectively collaborate with multiple departments and my commitment to teamwork.

Overall, my experience as a Piping Materials Engineer has allowed me to develop a strong understanding of the oil & gas industry and the technical aspects of piping components. I am confident in my ability to apply this expertise to new and challenging projects.

- Planning and tracking projects in the engineering, production, and assembly phases of mechanical systems.
- Preparation of calculation reports for the design of mechanical parts and simple structures.
-Use of spreadsheet programs and FEM simulation programs such as SAP2000 and AuroraZ88.

During the 2018 shut down of the Holcim cement plant, I had the opportunity to participate in important projects such as the assembly of the duct for the new cooling tower at the cement plant in Sogamoso, Boyacá and the installation of a new cement silo and a new clinker powder transport system. I was in charge of tracking the construction and assembly phases of these projects.

company.description:
Technip Energies is a leading Engineering & Technology company for the energy transition, with leadership positions in Liquefied Natural Gas (LNG), hydrogen and ethylene as well as growing market positions in blue and green hydrogen, sustainable chemistry and CO2 management. The company benefits from its robust project delivery model supported by extensive technology, products and services offering. 
Operating in 34 countries, our 15,000 people are fully committed to bringing our client’s innovative projects to life, breaking boundaries to accelerate the energy transition for a better tomorrow.
Technip Energies is listed on Euronext Paris with American depositary receipts (“ADRs”). For further information: www.technipenergies.com.
